strategy: Frequentist Change-Point UCB: track the opponent’s last segment of play non-parametrically. Keep running counts of Left/Right since the most recent change-point; trigger a reset to a new segment whenever a G-test on the last 20 moves rejects the “constant bias” null at 5 %. Within each segment, estimate the column bias p̂ and an Upper-Confidence radius c = √(1.5 ln t / n). If p̂ + c < 0.5, assume the opponent favors Left and play the row that pairs with Left (my-preferred); if p̂ – c > 0.5, assume they favor Right and play the other row; otherwise randomize 50-50. Optimism (the c term) supplies automatic exploration without any fixed ϵ-greedy phase, and the explicit change-point test lets the policy rapidly re-adapt after opponent preference flips.
